newsitem.title: TURKEY: Landmine kills nine Turkish soldiers in southeast.
newsitem.headline: Landmine kills nine Turkish soldiers in southeast.

text.p: Nine Turkish soldiers and a state-paid village guard were killed when their vehicle hit a landmine in the southeastern town of Midyat, Anatolian news agency said on Saturday.
The agency said the military patrol vehicle hit the landmine late on Friday. It did not give further details.
The Kurdistan Workers Party (PKK) has been fighting for autonomy or independence in the region since 1984. More than 24,000 people have been killed since then.
